info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:33PM CDT until April 22 at 6:36PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...Kansas...
Current River near Powder Mill affecting Shannon County.
Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County.
Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County.
Sac River near Caplinger Mills affecting Cedar County.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...
Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County.
Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County.
James River at Galena affecting Stone County.
James River near Boaz affecting Christian and Stone Counties.
Osage River at Taberville affecting Vernon and St. Clair Counties.
Elk River near Tiff City affecting McDonald County.
For the Current River...including Powder Mill...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Jacks Fork River...including Alley Spring, Eminence...Minor flooding is forecast. For the James River...including Galena, Boaz...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Osage River...including Fulton, Horton...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Osage River...including Taberville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sac River...including Caplinger Mills...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Elk River...including Tiff City...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Osage River at Fulton.
* WHEN...Until Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Farmland at the gage site becomes covered by flood waters, and Highway 31, east of town becomes flooded. Highway 31, four miles west of Fulton has flood waters four to six feet in depth.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Sunday was 24.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Monday evening at 700 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING
